title: [Gameplay] Rek'sai splash bug.
body:
Hello, so I'm not sure if this is just for me or others or could even be my computer.

So, I've got rek'sai and loved playing her though..I can't play her because for some odd reason sometimes if I unborrow on a angle sometimes my league of legends would crash going into a memory state which crashes my computer. It kinda reminds me of Nvidia's TDR issues but only occuring with rek'sai and no other champions. It's proven a rather pain to play against or with a Rek'sai. since somehow it crashes my laptop about 20% of the time she unborrows when I'm playing against, as i'm playing with her it's about 60% which is kinda annoying with restarting computers. I'm not sure if this is a bug to do with the model, game, client or just Nvidia in general.

{{champion:421}}  I don't know what is is about Rek'sai that crashes it even if I turn all my graphics and so forth to the lowest it still happens. thank you for looking into it, or if you know whats causing it. If it's Nvidia somehow causing this I'll be more happy to post a full on length post and give them a piece of my mind.

replies.body: The base skin. it still happens when I repair the actual game, I'm not sure why it's not repairing/redownlading the missing .dds

on a side note. since it seems to be when I am borrowed using tremor sense I think it might be this...since it's most I see in each R3D log.

> 000018.448|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added|  ERROR| Failed to load RekSaiW.dds
000018.448|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added|   WARN| r3dTexture EX: RekSaiW.dds - not found. Dummy texture created.
000018.531|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added|  ERROR| Can not open file <RekSaiW_burrowed.dds> *********
000018.531|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added|  ERROR| Failed to load RekSaiW_burrowed.dds
000018.531|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added|   WARN| r3dTexture EX: RekSaiW_burrowed.dds - not found. Dummy texture created.


THE MOST COMMON

>000091.166|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added|  ERROR| Effects could not find mesh file <global_ss_exhaust_Spiral.scb>.
000091.197|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added|  ERROR| Effects could not find mesh file <global_ss_exhaust_Spiral.scb>.

But i'm no master so this could be useless information.

Yeah, from here, it looks like it's missing a .dds file, and  a mesh. 

Are you using a skin for this, or is this just the base?
the DXDiag. It seems to only be happening when I'm borrowed as rek'sai. I've repaired the game and even tried rolling back the Nvidia driver and still got same results.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=ygovmdZq,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-06-28T07:04:59.804+0000)
>
> Hiya! 
> 
> Would you be able to attach your **DxDiag** and **r3dlogs** in a comment so we can take a look at what may be going on here? Does this happen with the base champion, or are you using a skin? 
> 
> Below you'll find where to locate the logs I've mentioned above. :]
> 
> **DxDiag:** 
> 
> * Press [Windows Key] (that is the key on the left side of the space bar, between ctrl and alt) + 'R'
> * Type dxdiag in the search bar and hit 'Ok'
> * The DirectX Diagnostic Tool will open. Press the "Save All Information..." button.
> * Choose where to save the file (for example, your desktop).
> * Attach the DxDiag to your response on the forums.
> 
> **r3dlogs**
> 
> * C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Logs\Game - R3d Logs
> 
> Thanks!


this is the r3dlog of the game. next post will be my dxdiag. also this is the entire log I have of the full game. If you can't find a bug there chances are when i crashed it didn't log it.

Hiya! 

Would you be able to attach your **DxDiag** and **r3dlogs** in a comment so we can take a look at what may be going on here? Does this happen with the base champion, or are you using a skin? 

Below you'll find where to locate the logs I've mentioned above. :]

**DxDiag:** 

* Press [Windows Key] (that is the key on the left side of the space bar, between ctrl and alt) + 'R'
* Type dxdiag in the search bar and hit 'Ok'
* The DirectX Diagnostic Tool will open. Press the "Save All Information..." button.
* Choose where to save the file (for example, your desktop).
* Attach the DxDiag to your response on the forums.

**r3dlogs**

* C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Logs\Game - R3d Logs

Thanks!
